Alexandria.Luna Park, Arlington:
Luna Park (also known as Washington Luna Park and Luna Park Washington D.C.) was a trolley park in Alexandria County (now Arlington County), Virginia, that operated between 1906 and 1915. The Washington, Alexandria, and Mount Vernon Electric Railway (later the Washington-Virginia Railway) constructed the amusement park for $350,000 in collaboration with the facility's designer and operator, Frederick Ingersoll.
The park occupied 34 acres (140,000 m2) near the present intersection of South Glebe Road and Jefferson Davis Highway (U. S. Route 1).
